fields.summary: Rumen TraceBuilder is emiting null as hostname

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
When topology.node.switch.mapping.impl is set to enable rack-locality resolution via the topology script, from the RM web-UI, we can see the rack information for each node. Running a job also reveals the information about rack-local map tasks launched at end of job completion on the client side.

But the hostname field for attempts in the JobHistory does not contain this rack information.

In case of hadoop-0.20 securiy or MRV1, hostname field of job history does contain rackid/hostname whereas in MRV2, hostname field only contains the hostIP. Thus this is a regression.
fields.summary: MR V2 jobhistory does not contain rack information

comments.body: patch submitted. pls review. Thanks

+1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12498583/MAPREDUCE-3035.patch
  against trunk revision .

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    +1 tests included.  The patch appears to include 6 new or modified tests.

    +1 javadoc.  The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

    +1 javac.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    +1 findbugs.  The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    +1 release audit.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    +1 core tests.  The patch passed unit tests in .

    +1 contrib tests.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/985//testReport/
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/985//console

This message is automatically generated.

Karam says that till now, hostname itself used to be of the form rackid/hostname. So tools like Rumen also depend on this format.

I for one like the separate API and the history field. Let me talk to folks taking care of Rumen.

Chackaravarthy, in the mean while, can you also dig up Rumen related details (src/tools/org/apache/hadoop/tools/rumen/)? My feeling is you need to fix Rumen either ways.
yeah sure. I will do that. Thanks

W.r.t Rumen, {{LoggedTaskAttempt}} should now support {{setNodeName(RackName, HostName)}} API. Also in {{JobBuilder}} (e.g. see line-532),  calls to {{LoggedTaskAttempt.setHostName()}} should be modified to {{LoggedTaskAttempt.setNodeName(RackName, HostName)}}.

Hopefully this will help you guys get started.
yeah thanks for your inputs Amar :-)
Hi Chackaravarthy, any update on this? Thanks.
Hi Arun, I am checking and will update soon. Thanks

I ran rumen tool executing TraceBuilder and Folder for the patch applied code.
It behaves same as previously. 
But as Amar said, we can add the rack info also for map and reduce tasks if required, but as of now this patch will not affect the rumen tool functioning.

-1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12500220/MAPREDUCE-3035-1.patch
  against trunk revision .

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    +1 tests included.  The patch appears to include 6 new or modified tests.

    +1 javadoc.  The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

    +1 javac.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    -1 findbugs.  The patch appears to introduce 160 new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    +1 release audit.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    +1 core tests.  The patch passed unit tests in .

    +1 contrib tests.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/1107//testReport/
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/1107//artifact/trunk/hadoop-mapreduce-project/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshadoop-mapreduce-client-app.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/1107//artifact/trunk/hadoop-mapreduce-project/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshadoop-mapreduce-client-core.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/1107//artifact/trunk/hadoop-mapreduce-project/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshadoop-mapreduce-client-common.html
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/1107//console

This message is automatically generated.

Please add new constructors of *AttemptFinishedEvent records to also log in racknames and deprecate the current ones so that MRV1 doesn't break. That way you don't need to resolve the racks again.

Also please add a test or two in TestJobHistoryParsing.

Like I said, Rumen will work as is, but it will always get the rackname as null as it tries to obtain rackname by parsing the current host-name. Please change the Rumen APIs to instead read this new rackName field in the JobHistory for obtaining the rack information.

Thanks.
This one stalled a bit. I am taking this one from here to completion.

Attaching updated patch:
 - Removed bugs related to multiple resolution of racks.
 - Made rumen related changes as suggested by Amar in the above comments
 - Fixed test to verify that the rack-name is getting logged properly in the JobHistoryServer

[~ravidotg] is helping me test this with Rumen.

+1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
